name: Amy's Place
short: Champaign LGBTQ+ bar (19+) — coming soon. Open 5pm–2am daily.
description: Amy's Place is a new LGBTQ+ bar in Champaign welcoming both the community and allies. The venue is 19+ and plans to be open from 5pm to 2am every day. Everyone is welcome in this inclusive space. As a new establishment, check their Facebook page for opening announcements and events.
notes: Coming soon. Phone: (217) 819-6102. Email: Amymyers75@gmail.com. Follow their Facebook page for updates and official opening date.

name: Anthem
short: 19+ nightclub in Champaign featuring a dance floor and late-night events.
description: Anthem is a 19+ nightclub in Champaign known for its dance floor, DJs, and energetic nightlife. It serves as a popular stop for students and locals looking for music-driven late-night events.
notes: Age policy is 19+. Check event listings for DJs and theme nights.

name: The Bistro (The B)
short: Nightlife bar and dance spot with a diverse and social crowd in Bloomington.
description: The Bistro is a nightlife bar in Bloomington offering drinks, dancing, and a casual social atmosphere.
notes: Event nights and hours may vary.

name: The Bridge United Methodist Church (Washington)
short: United Methodist church in Washington offering worship, groups, and community support.
description: The Bridge United Methodist Church is a Washington, IL congregation offering worship services, small groups, and community engagement. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Central Illinois Friends
short: Community center and clinic services including HIV/STI testing, PrEP/PEP, counseling, and trans health navigation.
description: Central Illinois Friends supports the LGBTQI+ community, people living with HIV, and the general public through compassionate, personalized care. Services include sexual health education, HIV/STI testing, PrEP/PEP, safer sex kits, support for people living with HIV, trans health navigation, and a free counseling program for LGBTQ+ folks and their families.
address: 2112 E War Memorial Dr, Peoria, IL 61614
notes: Main line: (309) 431-5880. Also has additional locations/clinic days listed on their website.

name: Clique
short: LGBTQ+ bar and nightclub known for drag shows, dancing, and community nightlife.
description: Clique is an LGBTQ+ bar and nightclub in Springfield offering a welcoming environment, drag performances, themed nights, and a lively dance floor. It’s a popular social space for the LGBTQ+ community and allies in the Springfield area.
notes: Known for drag shows and weekend events. Check social media for schedules.

name: Club Diesel
short: High-energy downtown nightclub with DJs, dancing, and an inclusive nightlife crowd.
description: Club Diesel is a longtime downtown Peoria nightclub known for its energetic dance floor, DJs, themed nights, and late-night atmosphere. The club draws a diverse crowd and is widely regarded as a welcoming nightlife space for LGBTQ+ patrons and allies.
notes: Typically open late. Check social media for themed nights and special events.

name: Community United Church of Christ (Morton)
short: United Church of Christ congregation in Morton focused on worship and community life.
description: Community United Church of Christ is a UCC congregation in Morton offering worship services, pastoral care, and community involvement. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Congregation Anshai Emeth
short: Reform Jewish congregation in Peoria offering worship, learning, and community.
description: Congregation Anshai Emeth is a Reform Jewish synagogue serving the Peoria area with Shabbat worship, lifecycle events, education, and community programming. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the synagogue website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Enough Stuff
short: Free thrift store and community space offering donated items to anyone in need at no cost.
description: Enough Stuff is a community-focused free thrift store in East Peoria where donated items — including clothing, household goods, books, hygiene products, and food pantry items — are given away for free to anyone who visits.
address: 422 E Washington St, Suite 100, East Peoria, IL 61611
notes: Open Tue–Sat with varying donation and shopping hours. Accepts up to one bag/box of items per donor per day.

name: Ezra at Stonewall Studio
short: Trans-owned barber and stylist offering affirming hair services by appointment in Peoria.
description: Ezra at Stonewall Studio provides personalized, gender-affirming hair services in a welcoming and respectful environment. Operating through a private studio setting, Ezra offers cuts and styling tailored to each client’s comfort, identity, and expression. Appointments are booked online, with a focus on creating an affirming experience for trans, nonbinary, and LGBTQ+ clients.
notes: Booking and service details available via GlossGenius. Location details provided after booking.

name: Fae Rae Photography
short: Creative portrait and event photography — studio and on-location services in Peoria and Central Illinois.
description: Fae Rae Photography offers professional photography sessions for families, children, newborns, seniors, events, and more.
notes: Email: faeraephotography@yahoo.com. Studio in Chillicothe serving the greater Peoria area.

name: FemmeCare Health & Wellness Center
short: Primary + gyne care with LGBTQ+ specific services including gender-affirming hormone treatment and PrEP/sexual health.
description: FemmeCare Health & Wellness Center provides primary and gyne care with LGBTQ+ specific services.
notes: Call: (309) 300-0834. Secure texting line: (309) 250-3810. Email: support@femmecarehealth.com.

name: First Baptist Church of Peoria
short: Historic Baptist church in Peoria with worship services and community ministries.
description: First Baptist Church of Peoria is a longtime Peoria congregation offering worship, faith formation, and community ministries. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Phone: (309) 682-5491 • Email: office@fbcpeoria.org

name: First Christian Church (Disciples of Christ) — Peoria
short: Disciples of Christ congregation in Peoria with worship, service, and community life.
description: First Christian Church (Disciples of Christ) in Peoria is a Christian congregation offering worship, community connection, and service opportunities. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: First Congregational UCC (Canton)
short: United Church of Christ congregation in Canton offering worship and community care.
description: First Congregational UCC is a Canton-based United Church of Christ congregation offering worship, pastoral care, and community engagement. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Glen Oak Christian Church
short: Peoria church offering worship and community life (listed as affirming by Peoria Proud).
description: Glen Oak Christian Church is a Peoria congregation offering worship services and community connection. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Phone: (309) 688-3464 • Email: glenoakchristian@sbcglobal.net

name: Imago Dei Church
short: Christian church in Peoria focused on worship, discipleship, and community life.
description: Imago Dei Church is a Christian congregation in Peoria offering worship services, spiritual formation, and community connection. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Jewish Federation of Peoria
short: Jewish community organization supporting connection, programs, and services in Peoria.
description: The Jewish Federation of Peoria supports Jewish life in the region through community programs, connection, and services. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community resource.
notes: Use the Federation website contact page for the most current phone/email and office hours.

name: Kickback on Fulton
short: LGBTQ-owned neighborhood bar offering a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere downtown.
description: Kickback on Fulton is an LGBTQ-owned bar in downtown Peoria known for its laid-back environment.
notes: Good option for low-key evenings. Hours may vary by day.

name: Lit. on Fire Books
short: Independent bookstore and community hub featuring a curated selection of new and used books and a welcoming, inclusive space.
description: Lit. on Fire Books is a women-owned, disabled, and LGBTQ+-owned independent bookstore in Peoria.
notes: Owned and operated by Jess (she/they). Typically open Tue–Sat 12pm–6pm.

name: Peoria Proud
short: LGBTQIA+ advocacy organization and primary organizer of River City Pride Festival and other LGBTQ-centered events in Peoria.
description: Peoria Proud is a local LGBTQIA+ advocacy and community organization dedicated to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout the Greater Peoria area. The organization is the primary organizer of River City Pride Festival and coordinates additional LGBTQ-centered events, outreach efforts, and visibility initiatives throughout the year. Through advocacy, education, and community programming, Peoria Proud works to foster connection, representation, and belonging for LGBTQIA+ people and allies across Central Illinois.
address: 2112 E. War Memorial Dr., Box 02, Peoria, IL 61614
notes: Contact email: admin@peoriaproud.org.

name: Positive Health Solutions
short: HIV/STI services, prevention (PrEP), case management, and gender-affirming intake in downtown Peoria.
description: Positive Health Solutions provides comprehensive HIV/STI testing, PrEP services, and gender-affirming intake.
address: 222 NE Monroe St, Suites 901 & 904, Peoria, IL 61602
notes: Clinic (Suite 904): (309) 671-8484. Case Management / Testing (Suite 901): (309) 671-8457.

name: Rebel Roots Hair Haus
short: Inclusive and creative hair salon offering cuts, color, styling, and personalized hair services in Peoria.
description: Rebel Roots Hair Haus is a dynamic and inclusive hair salon encouraging creativity and self-expression.
address: 5901 N Prospect Rd, Suite 107, Peoria, IL 61614
notes: Appointments recommended. Open Mon–Sat 9am–9pm.

name: Snyder’s Barbershop
short: Traditional barbershop offering haircuts, fades, beard trims, and grooming services in Peoria.
description: Snyder’s Barbershop is a Peoria-based barbershop providing classic and modern men’s grooming services, including haircuts, fades, beard trims, and straight-razor work. Known for a straightforward, professional approach, the shop serves clients looking for reliable barbering in a comfortable, no-frills environment.
notes: Appointments and walk-ins may vary by barber. Check the website for hours, services, and booking details.

name: Sparky's Ringside Bar & Grill
short: Neighborhood bar and grill with pool tables, affordable drinks, and a laid-back vibe.
description: Sparky’s Ringside Bar & Grill is a casual neighborhood bar in Peoria.
notes: Primarily a local hangout. Hours and specials may vary.

name: St. Paul’s Episcopal Church
short: Episcopal church in Peoria offering worship and congregational life.
description: St. Paul’s Episcopal Church is an Episcopal congregation in Peoria offering worship services, pastoral care, and community life. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.

name: Tartan Inn
short: Longtime neighborhood bar in West Peoria with live music, open mic nights, and a relaxed local vibe.
description: Tartan Inn is a cozy, longtime neighborhood bar in West Peoria known for its friendly staff, classic bar atmosphere, and strong local following. The bar regularly hosts live music on Thursday nights and open mic events on Sundays, making it a popular gathering spot for casual nights out and local performers.
address: 428 N Waverly Ave, West Peoria, IL 61604
notes: Live music typically Thursdays and open mic Sundays. Hours and events may vary—check social media or call ahead.

name: United Presbyterian Church of Peoria
short: Presbyterian (PCUSA) congregation in Peoria with worship, ministries, and community life.
description: United Presbyterian Church of Peoria is a PC(USA) congregation offering worship services, ministries, and community engagement. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Phone: (309) 693-2002 • Email: upc@unitedpc.org

name: Universalist Unitarian Church of Peoria
short: Unitarian Universalist congregation in Peoria focused on inclusion, justice, and community.
description: Universalist Unitarian Church of Peoria is a UU congregation offering services and community programs centered on spiritual exploration, inclusion, and social justice. It’s listed by Peoria Proud as an affirming faith community.
notes: Use the church website contact page for the most current phone/email and service times.
